item.title: How to run Google sites as standalone MacOS apps that Alfred can start
item.description: Many Google sites such as Meet, Drive and Youtube can be run as Progressive Web Apps (PWAs), which means they run in their own Chrome application and are treated as separate apps in MacOS.

item.title: You can display the typed text in Alfred in a huge typeface
item.description: By pressing cmd + L after typing the text.

item.title: How to configure Alfred's Bear workflow to open notes in the main window
item.description: This applies to the Bear workflow written in Go whose default behaviour (in v1.1.6) is to open notes in a new window rather than the main Bear application window.

item.title: About Alfred's clipboard history feature
item.description: Alfred has a clipboard history feature which lets you easily pluck out previous values from your system clipboard.
